channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nary a Critical Word: Bill Gates’s Close Bond With Narendra Modi
item.description: The relationship between the billionaire philanthropist and the Indian leader helps both men meet their missions. But it also papers over the erosion ...

item.title: A Measles Resurgence?
item.description: Our colleague traveled to the center of a Texas measles outbreak.

item.title: Wind and Solar Firms Have a Pitch for Trump: ‘You’re Going to Need Us’
item.description: Electricity demand is soaring and gas-burning power plants are in short supply. The renewable industry sees an opening — even if Washington is souring...

item.title: Orville Peck Confirms He Will Perform Unmasked in ‘Cabaret’
item.description: When the country singer landed a role in the splashy “Cabaret” revival, one question loomed large: Would he make his Broadway debut in a mask?

item.title: Renault and WeRide’s driverless bus put to the test on Barcelona streets
item.description: Renault’s initiative comes as Europe lags behind the U.S. and China in driverless vehicle technology, where companies are fiercely competing to get ah...

item.title: Violence in Syria Shows Difficulty in Unifying Armed Forces
item.description: Sectarian-driven killings of civilians this month displayed the government’s weak control over both its own forces and affiliated fighters, experts sa...

item.title: Exclusive: Inside Pillar VC’s $175 million fourth venture fund focused on the Boston tech ecosystem
item.description: Pillar takes a unique approach by focusing on startups coming out of university research.

item.title: U.S. to Withdraw From Group Investigating Responsibility for Ukraine Invasion
item.description: The decision is the latest indication of the Trump administration’s move away from holding President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia accountable for crime...

item.title: U.S. to Withdraw From Group Investigating Responsibility for Ukraine Invasion
item.description: The decision is the latest indication of the Trump administration’s move away from holding President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia accountable for crime...

item.title: People-smugglers are using TikTok videos piled with emojis and images of thick wads of cash to market services to dodge Trump border crackdown
item.description: Smugglers openly taunt U.S. authorities, with one taking a jab at Trump, referring to the president as a “high-strung gringo.”

item.title: Money Pours In for Cuomo and Mamdani in Mayoral Race
item.description: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Zohran Mamdani, a progressive state lawmaker from Queens, are leading the mayoral candidates in fund-raising.

item.title: Why political uncertainty is a career-defining moment for aspiring CEOs
item.description: Some leaders say economic uncertainty is a big career advantage.

item.title: How one man impacted by Trump’s federal funding freeze is helping other workers find new jobs
item.description: After being let go, Wayan Vota launched Career Pivot in an effort to other federal workers and contractors in the same situation.

item.title: Deportations Threaten Constitutional Showdown, and DOGE Cuts Hit Nuclear Agency
item.description: Plus, a retirement home for penguins.

item.title: How South Sudan Returned to the Brink of War
item.description: An attack on a U.N. helicopter has highlighted rising tensions in the world’s youngest country, where a seven-year-old peace deal looks ever more frag...
